prompt:
Nurse: That sounds lovely, Ms. Aguirre. It's always nice to spend time with family. How often do you get to see your mother?

Patient: Well, I'm sorry. I called her my mother. She's not really my mother. But

Nurse: I see, Ms. Aguirre. I apologize for misunderstanding. Could you please tell me more about this special person who's coming to visit?

Patient: She's my aunt that took care of me.

Nurse: I see, Ms. Aguirre. It's wonderful that you have such a close relationship with your aunt. It must be comforting to have her around. What activities do you usually enjoy doing together when she visits?

Patient: We just sit in play cards. You know? She's

Nurse: That sounds like a lovely way to spend time together, Ms. Aguirre. Card games can be a great way to relax and bond. Do you have a favorite card game that you enjoy playing with your aunt?

Patient: quite a bit older. So

responses.gpt4: I see, Ms. Aguirre. It can be quite special to share these moments with people we care about. Before we continue our conversation, may I ask if there are any symptoms related to your kidney disease that have been concerning you recently?
